archimate:Device.name: Handheld Two-Way Radios (HTWR)
archimate:Device.documentation:
Intended Use:
• Security team patrols and emergency responses • Facilities and maintenance teams • Clinical teams (Emergency Room, Wards, Surgical areas) • Emergency preparedness and disaster management coordination
Specifications:
• Frequency Range: o UHF (400–470 MHz) preferred for optimal indoor building penetration and clarity across multiple floors and buildings. DMR Tier III (Digital Mobile Radio) • Transmit Power: o Minimum 4–5 Watts (ensures reliable multi-building and multi-floor coverage within campus). • Battery Life: o 18hrs + solar/wireless charging option for continuous use per full charge, adequate for full shifts without interruption o rapid charging cradle or spare battery packs for quick swapping. • Durability Rating: o IP54–IP67 (water-resistant/splash-proof and dustproof) o MIL-STD-810G compliant, drop-resistant from at least 6 ft onto concrete o Rugged casing suitable for clinical, security, and facilities environments. • Operating Range: o Reliable coverage of at least 250,000–300,000 sq. ft. indoor area (to comfortably exceed the hospital’s 163,000 sq. ft. facility and ensure clear signal penetration across multi-story buildings). • Connectivity Options: o Analog/Digital dual-mode capability (supports smooth transition to digital system for improved clarity and privacy) o Bluetooth capability (wireless earpieces for hands-free operation). • Size and Weight: o Compact and lightweight (<10 ounces) for ease of carrying and prolonged use o Approximate dimensions: 5”–6” height, 2”–3” width, 1.5”–2” thickness. • Audio Quality: o Clear, distortion-free speaker audio o Noise-cancelling microphone for improved clarity in loud clinical or emergency environments o audio accessories (earpieces, headsets) for discreet and clear communication. • Interface and Control Layout: o Simple and intuitive layout o Large Push-to-Talk (PTT) button for quick, easy operation (even when wearing gloves) o Clearly labeled controls (volume, channel selector knob, emergency alert button) o LED indicators for battery status, signal strength, and channel/activity.
Recommended Accessories:
• Charging Dock and Spare Batteries: o Rapid multi-unit charger stations o Spare rechargeable battery packs for extended operations. • Carrying Solutions: o Rugged belt clips or holsters o shoulder harnesses or straps for easy carrying during extended shifts. • Audio Accessories: o Wired or Bluetooth wireless earpieces/headsets for hands-free operation and enhanced privacy. • Protective Equipment: o Durable cases or silicone covers for extra shock and drop protection.
